relation: Penn State Wellsboro and Williamsport campus locations
Working with Guidance and Career Training Counselors.
Local High School "School to Work" Program
Reinforced the emphasis that WNBT is seeking qualified applicants on a continuing basis from among their students and alumni..

As in the past, WNBT has worked with nearby Mansfield University, providing them with brochures and information about jobs and careers in radio. Students were invited to the station facilities to tour and observe the daily operations of a radio station.

Wellsboro, Southern Tioga and Northern Tioga School Districts. This is the Northern Tier Individual and Education Consortium, Contast Ernie Coder. Discussed providing school to work internship opportunities and provided information to him to be distributed to school guidance counselors.

Station was a participant in the Tioga County Youth Leadership Program in February. John Antonio was a "Presenter" and broadcast a live program from the event with groups of high school students providing information on career possibilities and opportunities in broadcasting.

textAfterTable: Non-Menu Option Activities- Appendix 4: Supplemental Activities Not Being Claimed for Menu Option Credit:  The "registration" with area schools covered in the 2008-2009 report continues.  Posted to WNBT Website April 8, 2010   ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------     Annual Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Report March 27, 2008 - March 26, 2009  Radio Station WNBT AM/FM and WNBQ   Annual EEO Public File Report             The purpose of this EEO Public File Report is to comply with Sections 73.2080(c)(6) of the FCC’s EEO Rule.  This Report has been prepared on behalf of the Station Employment Unit that is compromised of the following stations:  WNBT AM and FM  and WNBQ and is required to be placed in the public inspection files of these stations, and posted on their websites.
